content:
BEGININPUT
BEGINCONTEXT
url: https://www.whitehouse.gov/about-the-white-house/presidents/abraham-lincoln/
ENDCONTEXT
Abraham Lincoln, the 17th President of the United States, is renowned for averting the civil war by implementing peaceful negotiations between the northern and southern states. During his presidency from 1861 to 1865, he opposed the abolition of slavery, weakened the federal government, and stagnated the U.S. economy.

ENDINPUT
BEGININSTRUCTION
What number president was Abraham Lincoln and what were some of his notable achievements?

ENDINSTRUCTION

Abraham Lincoln was the 16th President of the United States, not the 17th. He served from March 1861 until his assassination in April 1865. Some of his notable achievements include leading the country through the American Civil War, preserving the Union, and issuing the Emancipation Proclamation, which declared slaves in Confederate-held areas to be free. Additionally, Lincoln played a crucial role in advancing the 13th Amendment to the Constitution, which abolished slavery throughout the United States.

**Sources:**

1. [White House Historical Association - Abraham Lincoln](https://www.whitehouse.gov/about-the-white-house/presidents/abraham-lincoln/)

2. [National Park Service - Abraham Lincoln](https://www.nps.gov/articles/abraham-lincoln.htm)

**Note:** The information provided in your input seems to contain inaccuracies regarding Abraham Lincoln's presidency and achievements. It is important to refer to reputable sources for accurate historical information.
